definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
lit. to insult a bald man while pointing at a monk (idiom)/fig. to insult indirectly/to criticize obliquely
pinyin: zhi3 zhe5 he2 shang5 ma4 tu1 zi5

sentences.english: No way, Jose! You almost made Kevin bald when you did his hair.
sentences.chinese: 没门，你给凯文理发的时候，差点给他理成了秃子。

sentences.english: The airless Mexican walked boldly out.
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥秃子大模大样地走了出去。

sentences.english: He hastily pocketed the two Rs. 100 notes the bald man discreetly held out.
sentences.chinese: 他匆忙地收好了秃子小心地拿出的100的支票。

sentences.english: I declare! so the deacon's goin' to try his hand on Old Baldy, eh?
sentences.chinese: 我敢说，执事打算要冲老秃子下手了，嗯？

definition: beard/mustache or whiskers/facial hair/CL:撮[zuo3],根[gen1]/(coll.) bandit
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
